{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3502544,"name":"David A Weeks","username":"Weeks1983","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weeks1983/{size}/86777_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T04:48:26.244Z","cooked":"

Since 90% of all activity will be in one’s own alliance section, the only fouls one can do is alone while during auto or teleop. I’m guessing robots that ruin game pieces or structures and touching the reef or net type foul. Then for the endgame, touching another robot trying to climb. The only reason one would venture into the other side is if their machine had damage or a failure and they only thing the bot could do is defend. Then the list of possible fouls include pinning, touching a robot in a protected zone or their scored game pieces. I’m probably missed one but fouls might be something that your scouts could ignore. That, and what reason, other than the example I gave, would you want to defend, let alone build one that just does that?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-05T04:48:26.244Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":175,"reads":327,"readers_count":326,"score":935.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":485255,"topic_slug":"reefscape-fouls","display_username":"David A Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36159,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/reefscape-fouls/485255/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3502548,"name":"Ethan Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T04:55:42.551Z","cooked":"

You could defend if you run out of things to do on your side. Let’s say you have three bots that can only do L1 and algae. At some point, there’s no more trough spots to score on and no more algae to score.

Also you forgot about the foul for controlling multiple game pieces.

Ummm. I think we may see quite a few bots that play defense on purpose…

CakeDeer6:

Also you forgot about the foul for controlling multiple game pieces.

That he did, and the foul for contacting the Anchor, and conveniently missed all the Human fouls, and for shedding bumpers, and for overextension…

While I wouldn’t necessarily have scouts track fouls, if they see why a flag goes up they should probably make a note.

I count roughly 68 fouls of all varieties. ~25 are not necessarily called during a match, or are specifically called NOT during a match. That leaves 43 in-match fouls that CAN be called. Typically, there will be about 5-10 that crop up at most events, and maybe 1-2 that are almost an every-match occurrence.

Then just have a robot that scores elsewhere. Then you’d never need to go to the other side. Yes, if I had a robot that only scored at L1, then I’d start learning how best to defend.

We’ve prepared for this. That’s why we built an elevator so needlessly large that we could score coral in the Barge if First decides to be cool and give us points for that.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-05T22:42:46.617Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":485255,"topic_slug":"reefscape-fouls","display_username":"David Berry","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":36159,"username":"Weeks1983","name":"David A Weeks","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weeks1983/{size}/86777_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70495,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3219 Assistant Coach"},"post_url":"/t/reefscape-fouls/485255/6","custom_user_title":"3219 Assistant Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3503500,"name":"Pat Mattin","username":"pmattin5459","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pmattin5459/{size}/182786_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T22:52:29.790Z","cooked":"

The thing that encourages defense in this game isn’t lack of scoring locations, it’s space. 2 robots cycling the Reef as quickly as possible on all levels have a solid chance of filling at least L3 and L4, probably most of L2. That leaves the 3rd robot with a few options:

  1. Try to collect and score fallen algae. Genuinely helpful for keeping the field clear, not very valuable in absolute points if in the Processor.
  2. Score L1/L2 coral. Potentially gets in the way of alliance partners both at the Coral station and at the Reef. Again, not worth much in points, Coral tends to fall off L1 earlier than you’d think.
  3. Play defense. You risk fouls, sure, but you could get pretty close to shutting down one human player station. Other alliance either has to get past or share, leading to the problem from part 2.

Which is best? Depends on the alliance and who they’re against.

Btw: building a robot that “scores everywhere” is not within every team’s resources. Even if they are capable of it, what matters is being able to do so well. I’ll take a solid Everybot over a robot that can kind of score on the higher levels any day of the week.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-05T22:52:29.790Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":51.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":485255,"topic_slug":"reefscape-fouls","display_username":"Pat Mattin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cheesecake Enthusiast"},"post_url":"/t/reefscape-fouls/485255/7","custom_user_title":"Cheesecake Enthusiast","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3503614,"name":"Javier V","username":"javiir","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/javiir/{size}/256936_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-06T00:40:53.178Z","cooked":"

I don’t think it’ll be as offense heavy as it seems. There’s been a lot of talk about how defense is still viable for this year’s game, especially in high level play where it might be more efficient to have one robot per coral station and have the third one play defense

(then again we just have to wait until week 1 of competitions to see how it actually plays out)

I didn’t say “everywhere” … just elsewhere. It would behoove a team to TRY to put coral somewhere else than L1 although you can put a LOT of coral in those L1 troughs.
